description: csi represents storage that is handled by an external CSI driver (Beta feature).
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi

description: controllerExpandSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI ControllerExpandVolume call. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.controllerExpandSecretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.controllerExpandSecretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.controllerExpandSecretRef.namespace

description: controllerPublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI ControllerPublishVolume and ControllerUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.controllerPublishSecretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.controllerPublishSecretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.controllerPublishSecretRef.namespace

description: driver is the name of the driver to use for this volume. Required.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.driver

description: fsType to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs".
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.fsType

description: nodeExpandSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodeExpandVolume call. This field is optional, may be omitted if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodeExpandSecretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodeExpandSecretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodeExpandSecretRef.namespace

description: nodePublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodePublishVolume and NodeUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodePublishSecretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodePublishSecretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodePublishSecretRef.namespace

description: nodeStageSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodeStageVolume and NodeStageVolume and NodeUnstageVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodeStageSecretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodeStageSecretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.nodeStageSecretRef.namespace

description: readOnly value to pass to ControllerPublishVolumeRequest. Defaults to false (read/write).
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.readOnly

description: volumeAttributes of the volume to publish.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.volumeAttributes

description: volumeHandle is the unique volume name returned by the CSI volume pluginâ€™s CreateVolume to refer to the volume on all subsequent calls. Required.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.csi.volumeHandle

description: fc represents a Fibre Channel resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.fc

description: fsType is the filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.fc.fsType

description: lun is Optional: FC target lun number
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.fc.lun

description: readOnly is Optional: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.fc.readOnly

description: targetWWNs is Optional: FC target worldwide names (WWNs)
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.fc.targetWWNs

description: wwids Optional: FC volume world wide identifiers (wwids) Either wwids or combination of targetWWNs and lun must be set, but not both simultaneously.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.fc.wwids

description: flexVolume represents a generic volume resource that is provisioned/attached using an exec based plugin.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume

description: driver is the name of the driver to use for this volume.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume.driver

description: fsType is the Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". The default filesystem depends on FlexVolume script.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume.fsType

description: options is Optional: this field holds extra command options if any.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume.options

description: readOnly is Optional: defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume.readOnly

description: secretRef is Optional: SecretRef is reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the plugin scripts. This may be empty if no secret object is specified. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed to the plugin scripts.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume.secretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume.secretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flexVolume.secretRef.namespace

description: flocker represents a Flocker volume attached to a kubelet's host machine and exposed to the pod for its usage. This depends on the Flocker control service being running
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flocker

description: datasetName is Name of the dataset stored as metadata -> name on the dataset for Flocker should be considered as deprecated
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flocker.datasetName

description: datasetUUID is the UUID of the dataset. This is unique identifier of a Flocker dataset
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.flocker.datasetUUID

description: gcePersistentDisk represents a GCE Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.gcePersistentDisk

description: fsType is filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.gcePersistentDisk.fsType

description: partition is the partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.gcePersistentDisk.partition

description: pdName is unique name of the PD resource in GCE. Used to identify the disk in GCE. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.gcePersistentDisk.pdName

description: readOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.gcePersistentDisk.readOnly

description: glusterfs represents a Glusterfs volume that is attached to a host and exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.glusterfs

description: endpoints is the endpoint name that details Glusterfs topology. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.glusterfs.endpoints

description: endpointsNamespace is the namespace that contains Glusterfs endpoint. If this field is empty, the EndpointNamespace defaults to the same namespace as the bound PVC. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.glusterfs.endpointsNamespace

description: path is the Glusterfs volume path. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.glusterfs.path

description: readOnly here will force the Glusterfs volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.glusterfs.readOnly

description: hostPath represents a directory on the host. Provisioned by a developer or tester. This is useful for single-node development and testing only! On-host storage is not supported in any way and WILL NOT WORK in a multi-node cluster. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#hostpath
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.hostPath

description: path of the directory on the host. If the path is a symlink, it will follow the link to the real path. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#hostpath
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.hostPath.path

description: type for HostPath Volume Defaults to "" More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#hostpath
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.hostPath.type

description: iscsi represents an ISCSI Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi

description: chapAuthDiscovery defines whether support iSCSI Discovery CHAP authentication
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.chapAuthDiscovery

description: chapAuthSession defines whether support iSCSI Session CHAP authentication
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.chapAuthSession

description: fsType is the filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#iscsi
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.fsType

description: initiatorName is the custom iSCSI Initiator Name. If initiatorName is specified with iscsiInterface simultaneously, new iSCSI interface <target portal>:<volume name> will be created for the connection.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.initiatorName

description: iqn is Target iSCSI Qualified Name.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.iqn

description: iscsiInterface is the interface Name that uses an iSCSI transport. Defaults to 'default' (tcp).
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.iscsiInterface

description: lun is iSCSI Target Lun number.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.lun

description: portals is the iSCSI Target Portal List. The Portal is either an IP or ip_addr:port if the port is other than default (typically TCP ports 860 and 3260).
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.portals

description: readOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.readOnly

description: secretRef is the CHAP Secret for iSCSI target and initiator authentication
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.secretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.secretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.secretRef.namespace

description: targetPortal is iSCSI Target Portal. The Portal is either an IP or ip_addr:port if the port is other than default (typically TCP ports 860 and 3260).
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.iscsi.targetPortal

description: local represents directly-attached storage with node affinity
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.local

description: fsType is the filesystem type to mount. It applies only when the Path is a block device. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". The default value is to auto-select a filesystem if unspecified.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.local.fsType

description: path of the full path to the volume on the node. It can be either a directory or block device (disk, partition, ...).
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.local.path

description: mountOptions is the list of mount options, e.g. ["ro", "soft"]. Not validated - mount will simply fail if one is invalid. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#mount-options
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.mountOptions

description: nfs represents an NFS mount on the host. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nfs

description: path that is exported by the NFS server. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nfs.path

description: readOnly here will force the NFS export to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nfs.readOnly

description: server is the hostname or IP address of the NFS server. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nfs.server

description: nodeAffinity defines constraints that limit what nodes this volume can be accessed from. This field influences the scheduling of pods that use this volume.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity

description: required specifies hard node constraints that must be met.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required

description: Required. A list of node selector terms. The terms are ORed.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms

description: A list of node selector requirements by node's labels.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchExpressions

description: The label key that the selector applies to.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchExpressions.*.key

description: Represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist. Gt, and Lt.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchExpressions.*.operator

description: An array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchExpressions.*.values

description: A list of node selector requirements by node's fields.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchFields

description: The label key that the selector applies to.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchFields.*.key

description: Represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist. Gt, and Lt.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchFields.*.operator

description: An array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.nodeAffinity.required.nodeSelectorTerms.*.matchFields.*.values

description: persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy defines what happens to a persistent volume when released from its claim. Valid options are Retain (default for manually created PersistentVolumes), Delete (default for dynamically provisioned PersistentVolumes), and Recycle (deprecated). Recycle must be supported by the volume plugin underlying this PersistentVolume. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#reclaiming
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy

description: photonPersistentDisk represents a PhotonController persistent disk attached and mounted on kubelets host machine
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.photonPersistentDisk

description: fsType is the filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.photonPersistentDisk.fsType

description: pdID is the ID that identifies Photon Controller persistent disk
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.photonPersistentDisk.pdID

description: portworxVolume represents a portworx volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.portworxVolume

description: fSType represents the filesystem type to mount Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.portworxVolume.fsType

description: readOnly defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.portworxVolume.readOnly

description: volumeID uniquely identifies a Portworx volume
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.portworxVolume.volumeID

description: quobyte represents a Quobyte mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.quobyte

description: group to map volume access to Default is no group
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.quobyte.group

description: readOnly here will force the Quobyte volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.quobyte.readOnly

description: registry represents a single or multiple Quobyte Registry services specified as a string as host:port pair (multiple entries are separated with commas) which acts as the central registry for volumes
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.quobyte.registry

description: tenant owning the given Quobyte volume in the Backend Used with dynamically provisioned Quobyte volumes, value is set by the plugin
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.quobyte.tenant

description: user to map volume access to Defaults to serivceaccount user
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.quobyte.user

description: volume is a string that references an already created Quobyte volume by name.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.quobyte.volume

description: rbd represents a Rados Block Device mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd

description: fsType is the filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#rbd
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.fsType

description: image is the rados image name. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.image

description: keyring is the path to key ring for RBDUser. Default is /etc/ceph/keyring. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.keyring

description: monitors is a collection of Ceph monitors. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.monitors

description: pool is the rados pool name. Default is rbd. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.pool

description: readOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.readOnly

description: secretRef is name of the authentication secret for RBDUser. If provided overrides keyring. Default is nil. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.secretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.secretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.secretRef.namespace

description: user is the rados user name. Default is admin. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.rbd.user

description: scaleIO represents a ScaleIO persistent volume attached and mounted on Kubernetes nodes.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO

description: fsType is the filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Default is "xfs"
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.fsType

description: gateway is the host address of the ScaleIO API Gateway.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.gateway

description: protectionDomain is the name of the ScaleIO Protection Domain for the configured storage.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.protectionDomain

description: readOnly defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.readOnly

description: secretRef references to the secret for ScaleIO user and other sensitive information. If this is not provided, Login operation will fail.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.secretRef

description: name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.secretRef.name

description: namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.secretRef.namespace

description: sslEnabled is the flag to enable/disable SSL communication with Gateway, default false
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.sslEnabled

description: storageMode indicates whether the storage for a volume should be ThickProvisioned or ThinProvisioned. Default is ThinProvisioned.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.storageMode

description: storagePool is the ScaleIO Storage Pool associated with the protection domain.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.storagePool

description: system is the name of the storage system as configured in ScaleIO.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.system

description: volumeName is the name of a volume already created in the ScaleIO system that is associated with this volume source.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.scaleIO.volumeName

description: storageClassName is the name of StorageClass to which this persistent volume belongs. Empty value means that this volume does not belong to any StorageClass.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageClassName

description: storageOS represents a StorageOS volume that is attached to the kubelet's host machine and mounted into the pod More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/storageos/README.md
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos

description: fsType is the filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.fsType

description: readOnly defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.readOnly

description: secretRef specifies the secret to use for obtaining the StorageOS API credentials. If not specified, default values will be attempted.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef

description: API version of the referent.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef.apiVersion

description: If referring to a piece of an object instead of an entire object, this string should contain a valid JSON/Go field access statement, such as desiredState.manifest.containers[2]. For example, if the object reference is to a container within a pod, this would take on a value like: "spec.containers{name}" (where "name" refers to the name of the container that triggered the event) or if no container name is specified "spec.containers[2]" (container with index 2 in this pod). This syntax is chosen only to have some well-defined way of referencing a part of an object.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef.fieldPath

description: Kind of the referent. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef.kind

description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef.name

description: Namespace of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef.namespace

description: Specific resourceVersion to which this reference is made, if any. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef.resourceVersion

description: UID of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#uids
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.secretRef.uid

description: volumeName is the human-readable name of the StorageOS volume. Volume names are only unique within a namespace.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.volumeName

description: volumeNamespace specifies the scope of the volume within StorageOS. If no namespace is specified then the Pod's namespace will be used. This allows the Kubernetes name scoping to be mirrored within StorageOS for tighter integration. Set VolumeName to any name to override the default behaviour. Set to "default" if you are not using namespaces within StorageOS. Namespaces that do not pre-exist within StorageOS will be created.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.storageos.volumeNamespace

description: Name of VolumeAttributesClass to which this persistent volume belongs. Empty value is not allowed. When this field is not set, it indicates that this volume does not belong to any VolumeAttributesClass. This field is mutable and can be changed by the CSI driver after a volume has been updated successfully to a new class. For an unbound PersistentVolume, the volumeAttributesClassName will be matched with unbound PersistentVolumeClaims during the binding process. This is an alpha field and requires enabling VolumeAttributesClass feature.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.volumeAttributesClassName

description: volumeMode defines if a volume is intended to be used with a formatted filesystem or to remain in raw block state. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in spec.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.volumeMode

description: vsphereVolume represents a vSphere volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.vsphereVolume

description: fsType is filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.vsphereVolume.fsType

description: storagePolicyID is the storage Policy Based Management (SPBM) profile ID associated with the StoragePolicyName.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.vsphereVolume.storagePolicyID

description: storagePolicyName is the storage Policy Based Management (SPBM) profile name.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.vsphereVolume.storagePolicyName

description: volumePath is the path that identifies vSphere volume vmdk
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.inlineVolumeSpec.vsphereVolume.volumePath

description: persistentVolumeName represents the name of the persistent volume to attach.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.spec.source.persistentVolumeName

description: status represents status of the VolumeAttachment request. Populated by the entity completing the attach or detach operation, i.e. the external-attacher.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status

description: attachError represents the last error encountered during attach operation, if any. This field must only be set by the entity completing the attach operation, i.e. the external-attacher.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.attachError

description: message represents the error encountered during Attach or Detach operation. This string may be logged, so it should not contain sensitive information.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.attachError.message

description: time represents the time the error was encountered.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.attachError.time

description: attached indicates the volume is successfully attached. This field must only be set by the entity completing the attach operation, i.e. the external-attacher.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.attached

description: attachmentMetadata is populated with any information returned by the attach operation, upon successful attach, that must be passed into subsequent WaitForAttach or Mount calls. This field must only be set by the entity completing the attach operation, i.e. the external-attacher.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.attachmentMetadata

description: detachError represents the last error encountered during detach operation, if any. This field must only be set by the entity completing the detach operation, i.e. the external-attacher.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.detachError

description: message represents the error encountered during Attach or Detach operation. This string may be logged, so it should not contain sensitive information.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.detachError.message

description: time represents the time the error was encountered.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttachments.<name>.status.detachError.time

description: VolumeAttributesClass represents a specification of mutable volume attributes defined by the CSI driver. The class can be specified during dynamic provisioning of PersistentVolumeClaims, and changed in the PersistentVolumeClaim spec after provisioning.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses

description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.apiVersion

description: Name of the CSI driver This field is immutable.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.driverName

description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.kind

description: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata

description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/annotations
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.annotations

description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.creationTimestamp

description: Number of seconds allowed for this object to gracefully terminate before it will be removed from the system. Only set when deletionTimestamp is also set. May only be shortened. Read-only.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.deletionGracePeriodSeconds

description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked. Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time. For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds, the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup, remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the resource is fully terminated. If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.deletionTimestamp

description: Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.finalizers

description:
GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server.

If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will return a 409.

Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.generateName

description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state. Populated by the system. Read-only.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.generation

description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.labels

description: ManagedFields maps workflow-id and version to the set of fields that are managed by that workflow. This is mostly for internal housekeeping, and users typically shouldn't need to set or understand this field. A workflow can be the user's name, a controller's name, or the name of a specific apply path like "ci-cd". The set of fields is always in the version that the workflow used when modifying the object.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields

description: APIVersion defines the version of this resource that this field set applies to. The format is "group/version" just like the top-level APIVersion field. It is necessary to track the version of a field set because it cannot be automatically converted.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.apiVersion

description: FieldsType is the discriminator for the different fields format and version. There is currently only one possible value: "FieldsV1"
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.fieldsType

description: FieldsV1 holds the first JSON version format as described in the "FieldsV1" type.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.fieldsV1

description: Manager is an identifier of the workflow managing these fields.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.manager

description: Operation is the type of operation which lead to this ManagedFieldsEntry being created. The only valid values for this field are 'Apply' and 'Update'.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.operation

description: Subresource is the name of the subresource used to update that object, or empty string if the object was updated through the main resource. The value of this field is used to distinguish between managers, even if they share the same name. For example, a status update will be distinct from a regular update using the same manager name. Note that the APIVersion field is not related to the Subresource field and it always corresponds to the version of the main resource.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.subresource

description: Time is the timestamp of when the ManagedFields entry was added. The timestamp will also be updated if a field is added, the manager changes any of the owned fields value or removes a field. The timestamp does not update when a field is removed from the entry because another manager took it over.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.managedFields.*.time

description: Name must be unique within a namespace. Is required when creating resources, although some resources may allow a client to request the generation of an appropriate name automatically. Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration definition. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names#names
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.name

description:
Namespace defines the space within which each name must be unique. An empty namespace is equivalent to the "default" namespace, but "default" is the canonical representation. Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for those objects will be empty.

Must be a DNS_LABEL. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.namespace

description: List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have been deleted, this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller, then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true. There cannot be more than one managing controller.
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.ownerReferences

description: API version of the referent.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.ownerReferences.<name>.apiVersion

description: If true, AND if the owner has the "foregroundDeletion" finalizer, then the owner cannot be deleted from the key-value store until this reference is removed. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/architecture/garbage-collection/#foreground-deletion for how the garbage collector interacts with this field and enforces the foreground deletion. Defaults to false. To set this field, a user needs "delete" permission of the owner, otherwise 422 (Unprocessable Entity) will be returned.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.ownerReferences.<name>.blockOwnerDeletion

description: If true, this reference points to the managing controller.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.ownerReferences.<name>.controller

description: Kind of the referent. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.ownerReferences.<name>.kind

description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names#names
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.ownerReferences.<name>.name

description: UID of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names#uids
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.ownerReferences.<name>.uid

description:
An opaque value that represents the internal version of this object that can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed. May be used for optimistic concurrency, change detection, and the watch operation on a resource or set of resources. Clients must treat these values as opaque and passed unmodified back to the server. They may only be valid for a particular resource or set of resources.

Populated by the system. Read-only. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and . More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.resourceVersion

description: Deprecated: selfLink is a legacy read-only field that is no longer populated by the system.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.selfLink

description:
UID is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is typically generated by the server on successful creation of a resource and is not allowed to change on PUT operations.

Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names#uids
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.metadata.uid

description:
parameters hold volume attributes defined by the CSI driver. These values are opaque to the Kubernetes and are passed directly to the CSI driver. The underlying storage provider supports changing these attributes on an existing volume, however the parameters field itself is immutable. To invoke a volume update, a new VolumeAttributesClass should be created with new parameters, and the PersistentVolumeClaim should be updated to reference the new VolumeAttributesClass.

This field is required and must contain at least one key/value pair. The keys cannot be empty, and the maximum number of parameters is 512, with a cumulative max size of 256K. If the CSI driver rejects invalid parameters, the target PersistentVolumeClaim will be set to an "Infeasible" state in the modifyVolumeStatus field.
name: applications.<name>.resources.volumeAttributesClasses.<name>.parameters

default: config.nixidy.defaults.syncPolicy.autoSync.enabled
description: Specifies if application should automatically sync.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.autoSync.enabled

default: config.nixidy.defaults.syncPolicy.autoSync.prune
description: Specifies if resources should be pruned during auto-syncing.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.autoSync.prune

default: config.nixidy.defaults.syncPolicy.autoSync.selfHeal
description: Specifies if partial app sync should be executed when resources are changed only in target Kubernetes cluster and no git change detected.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.autoSync.selfHeal

description: Currently when syncing using auto sync Argo CD applies every object in the application. For applications containing thousands of objects this takes quite a long time and puts undue pressure on the api server. Turning on selective sync option which will sync only out-of-sync resources.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.syncOptions.applyOutOfSyncOnly

description: By default, Argo CD will apply all manifests found in the git path configured in the Application regardless if the resources defined in the yamls are already applied by another Application. If the failOnSharedResource sync option is set, Argo CD will fail the sync whenever it finds a resource in the current Application that is already applied in the cluster by another Application.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.syncOptions.failOnSharedResource

description: This feature is to allow the ability for resource pruning to happen as a final, implicit wave of a sync operation, after the other resources have been deployed and become healthy, and after all other waves completed successfully.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.syncOptions.pruneLast

description:
By default, Argo CD executes kubectl apply operation to apply the configuration stored in Git. In some cases kubectl apply is not suitable. For example, resource spec might be too big and won't fit into kubectl.kubernetes.io/last-applied-configuration annotation that is added by kubectl apply.

If the replace = true; sync option is set the Argo CD will use kubectl replace or kubectl create command to apply changes.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.syncOptions.replace

description:
By default, Argo CD executes kubectl apply operation to apply the configuration stored in Git. This is a client side operation that relies on kubectl.kubernetes.io/last-applied-configuration annotation to store the previous resource state.

If serverSideApply = true; sync option is set, Argo CD will use kubectl apply --server-side command to apply changes.

More info here.
name: applications.<name>.syncPolicy.syncOptions.serverSideApply

description:
List of Kubernetes manifests declared in YAML strings. They will be parsed and added to the application's resources where they can be overwritten and modified.

Can be useful for reading existing YAML files (i.e. [(builtins.readFile ./deployment.yaml)]).
example: [ '' apiVersion: v1 kind: Namespace metadata: name: default '' ]
name: applications.<name>.yamls

description: Name of the application for bootstrapping all other applications (app of apps pattern).
name: nixidy.appOfApps.name

description: Destination namespace for generated Argo CD Applications in the app of apps applications.
name: nixidy.appOfApps.namespace

description: The project of the generated bootstrap app for appOfApps
name: nixidy.appOfApps.project

description: The revision being built. Will be written to .revision in the environment destination directory.
example: if (self ? rev) then self.rev else self.dirtyRev
name: nixidy.build.revision

description: Attrset of derivations containing helm charts. This will be passed as charts to every module.
name: nixidy.charts

description: Path to a directory containing sub-directory structure that can be used to build a charts attrset. This will be passed as charts to every module.
name: nixidy.chartsDir

description:
The Kubernetes server that ArgoCD should deploy all applications to.

This is the default value for all applications if not explicitly set for the application.
name: nixidy.defaults.destination.server

description: Function that will be applied to the list of rendered manifests after the helm templating. This option applies to all helm releases in all applications unless explicitly specified there.
example: map (lib.kube.removeLabels ["helm.sh/chart"])
type: function that evaluates to a(n) list of attribute set of anything
name: nixidy.defaults.helm.transformer

description: Function that will be applied to the list of rendered manifests after kustomize rendering. This option applies to all kustomize applications in all nixidy applications unless explicitly specified there.
example: map (lib.kube.removeLabels ["app.kubernetes.io/version"])
type: function that evaluates to a(n) list of attribute set of anything
name: nixidy.defaults.kustomize.transformer

description:
Specifies if applications should automatically sync.

This is the default value for all applications if not explicitly set for the application.
name: nixidy.defaults.syncPolicy.autoSync.enabled

description:
Specifies if resources should be pruned during auto-syncing.

This is the default value for all applications if not explicitly set for the application.
name: nixidy.defaults.syncPolicy.autoSync.prune

description:
Specifies if partial app sync should be executed when resources are changed only in target Kubernetes cluster and no git change detected.

This is the default value for all applications if not explicitly set for the application.
name: nixidy.defaults.syncPolicy.autoSync.selfHeal

description: Extra files to write in the generated stage.
name: nixidy.extraFiles

description: Path of output file.
name: nixidy.extraFiles.<name>.path

description: Text of the output file.
name: nixidy.extraFiles.<name>.text

description: List of modules to import for resource defintion options.
type: list of (package or path or function that evaluates to a(n) (attribute set))
name: nixidy.resourceImports

description: The destination branch of the generated applications.
name: nixidy.target.branch

description: The repository URL to put in all generated applications.
name: nixidy.target.repository

description: The root path of all generated applications in the repository.
name: nixidy.target.rootPath
